(int) - CrystalLeaderboards::positionForLeaderboardEntry:
 Get the position of a leaderboard entry. This is a convenience method to extract data from the array items returned from top20EntriesForLeaderboardID: et al.
(NSString *) - CrystalLeaderboards::percentileRankForLeaderboardEntry:
 Get the percentile rank of a leaderboard entry. This is a convenience method to extract data from the array items returned from top20EntriesForLeaderboardID: et al.
(double) - CrystalLeaderboards::scoreForLeaderboardEntry:
 Returns the score for the supplied entry as a numeric value This is a convenience method to extract data from the array items returned from top20EntriesForLeaderboardID: et al Note that you should use timeForLeaderboardEntry: for time-based scores.
(NSTimeInterval) - CrystalLeaderboards::timeForLeaderboardEntry:
 Returns the score of the supplied entry as a time-based value This is a convenience method to extract data from the array items returned from top20EntriesForLeaderboardID: et al Note that you should use scoreForLeaderboardEntry: for numeric scores.

Function Documentation

- (NSString*) percentileRankForLeaderboardEntry: (NSDictionary *)  leaderboardEntry

Get the percentile rank of a leaderboard entry. This is a convenience method to extract data from the array items returned from top20EntriesForLeaderboardID: et al.

Returns:
nil if the percentile rank is not available (for instance for random entries) otherwise returns a string such as "top 10%"
- (int) positionForLeaderboardEntry: (NSDictionary *)  DEPRECATED_ATTRIBUTE

Get the position of a leaderboard entry. This is a convenience method to extract data from the array items returned from top20EntriesForLeaderboardID: et al.

Returns:
-1 if the position is not available (for instance for random entries)
Deprecated:
This method has now been deprecated because of performance issues related to calculating the exact position of a leaderboard entry. Please get in touch via Crystal Developer Support <devsupport@crystalsdk.com> if you rely on this method. In general you should be fine to use the relative position in your UI - i.e. the position of the entry in the array
- (double) scoreForLeaderboardEntry: (NSDictionary *)  leaderboardEntry

Returns the score for the supplied entry as a numeric value This is a convenience method to extract data from the array items returned from top20EntriesForLeaderboardID: et al Note that you should use timeForLeaderboardEntry: for time-based scores.

Returns:
The leaderboard score
- (NSTimeInterval) timeForLeaderboardEntry: (NSDictionary *)  leaderboardEntry

Returns the score of the supplied entry as a time-based value This is a convenience method to extract data from the array items returned from top20EntriesForLeaderboardID: et al Note that you should use scoreForLeaderboardEntry: for numeric scores.

Returns:
the leaderboard time value
- (NSString*) userIdForLeaderboardEntry: (NSDictionary *)  leaderboardEntry

Get the user Id from a leaderboard entry.

Returns:
The user Id or nil if no user Id available
- (NSString*) usernameForLeaderboardEntry: (NSDictionary *)  leaderboardEntry

Get the username from a leaderboard entry.

Returns:
The username or nil if no username available
